title: Drawing, "Vis-à-vis", ca. 1750
medium: Brush and blue and brown wash, pen and brown ink on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Sketch of a carriage which allowed people to sit facing one another.  Consisted of a rectangular shaped body with a light blue canopied roof.  Frill hands from the top of the canopy as two light blue curtains hand and wrap around poles carved unto standing female figures.  At center a door.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Vis-à-vis", ca. 1750.
ca. 1750. Brush and blue and brown wash, pen and brown ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-217.
